alert.note: Alert for Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Georgetown and south central Williamsburg Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong showers with isolated thunderstorms over Lambert, or across the southwest corner of Georgetown County and extreme southeast Williamsburg County. This activity to develop and remain nearly stationary. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy rainfall within a short period could produce temporary localized flooding and ponding. In addition...wind gusts up to 30 mph are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Do not drive across water covered roadways. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Lambert, Earle and Sampit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
